verses.kjv: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O LORD.
verses.ct: From the deepest despair, I have called out to you, LORD.

verses.kjv: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
verses.ct: Lord, listen to me! Pay close attention to my desperate pleas.

verses.kjv: If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
verses.ct: If you kept a record of every sin, LORD, who could possibly survive?

verses.kjv: But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.
verses.ct: But you offer forgiveness, so that people will be wholeheartedly dedicated to you.

verses.kjv: I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
verses.ct: I wait for the LORD — my soul waits — and I put my hope in his word.

verses.kjv: My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.
verses.ct: My soul longs for the Lord more than night guards long for the dawn — yes, more than night guards long for the dawn.

verses.kjv: Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.
verses.ct: Israel, put your hope in the LORD, because the LORD is full of mercy, and he offers abundant redemption.

verses.kjv: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
verses.ct: He himself will redeem Israel from all their sins.
